Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In Orchestra Framework, create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create an administrator context called "SecondContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Unfold the "SecondContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Orchestra" category
Create a "MyVar" variable
In the context filter, type "Inherited"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "SecondContext" and "AdminContext content are no longer visible in the context viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Reset the context filter

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "SecondContext" and "AdminContext" contexts are back in the context viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the context filter, type "MyVar"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "AdminContext" and "InheritedAdminContext" contexts are no longer visible the context viewer. The "Orchestra" category is displayed in the variable viewer and the "MyVar" variable is displayed in bold

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In Orchestra Framework, create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create an administrator context called "SecondContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
In the "Orchestra" category of the "AdminContext" context, create a "Variable0" variable and save
In the "Orchestra" category of the "SecondContext" context, create a "Variable1" mandatory variable with no value and save
Right-clic on the context viewer and clic on Synchronise all
In the "Orchestra" category of the "InheritedAdminContext", change the value of the "Variable0" variable
In the Variables view, click on the bottom arrow, in the top right corner, and select "Show contributed elements"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the context viewer, both "Orchestra" categories of contexts "AdminContext" and "SecondContext" are highlighted

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Orchestra" category of the "AdminContext" context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Only "Variable0" variable is displayed in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Orchestra" category of the "SecondContext" context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Only "Variable1" variable is displayed in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Variables view, click on the bottom arrow, in the top right corner, and unselect "Show contributed elements"
In the Variables view, click on the bottom arrow, in the top right corner, and select "Show empty mandatory variables"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the context viewer, the "Orchestra" category of all contexts are highlighted

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Orchestra" category of the "SecondContext" context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: "Variable1" variable is displayed in the variable viewer (with ArtefactPath and ConfigurationDirectories)

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the Variables view, click on the bottom arrow, in the top right corner, and unselect "Show empty mandatory variables"
In the Variables view, click on the bottom arrow, in the top right corner, and select "Show overriden variables"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the context viewer, the "Orchestra" category of context "InheritedAdminContext" is highlighted

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "Orchestra" category of the "InheritedAdminContext" context

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Only "Variable0" variable is displayed in the variable viewer
